Dear all,
I want to share a minor detail I learned when compiling Cantera w=
ith
all interfaces on x86_64 Linux.  The compilation is of the cantera
code=
 checked out of CVS on 3/22/06.
Namely that by changing the following line =
in file configure from:
CXXFLAGS=3D${CXXFLAGS:=3D"-O0 -Wall"}
to:
CXXFLAGS=
=3D${CXXFLAGS:=3D"-O0 -Wall -fPIC"}

Solved issues associated with the foll=
owing error:
relocation R_X86_64_32 against `vtable for Cantera::MultiJac' =
can not
be used when making a shared object; recompile with -fPIC
liboneD.a=
: could notread symbols: Bad value
collect2: ld returned 1 exit status

Ess=
entially it seems that some fo the libraries were not compiled with
-fPIC a=
nd then were attempted to link with PIC compiled libraries.

However, I sti=
ll see following warrnings:
GasKinetics.cpp:564: warning: converting to `in=
t' from `doublereal'

-Tom
